maker: Attributed to André-Charles Boulle, and perhaps Royal Factory of Furniture to the Crown at the Gobelins Manufactory
title: Box
description: Box; Attributed to André-Charles Boulle (French, 1642 - 1732, master before 1666), and perhaps Royal Factory of Furniture to the Crown at the Gobelins Manufactory (French, founded 1662 - present); Paris, France; about 1675 - 1680; White oak veneered with amaranth, barberry, bloodwood, natural and stained boxwood, cedar, cherry, holly, green-stained hornbeam, mahogany, padouk, natural and stained maple, walnut, yew, and an unidentified wood; horn and pewter; fittings of steel; 41.9 x 66 x 43.2 cm (16 1/2 x 26 x 17 in.); 84.DA.971; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
